components.description: A block of dark chocolate, usually shown in a red foil wrapper peeled back to show squares of the candy. WhatsApp displays the wrapper in purple, a color commonly associated with Cadbury chocolate.
components.title: Chocolate Bar

description: A block of dark chocolate, usually shown in a red foil wrapper peeled back to show squares of the candy. WhatsApp displays the wrapper in purple, a color commonly associated with Cadbury chocolate.
title: Chocolate Bar

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Food symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: A block of chocolate, shown as squares with a foil wrapper. Chocolate Bar was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 http://emojipedia.org/chocolate-bar/
emoji_net_data.name: chocolate bar

bn:00111540a: Having or denoting the characteristic taste of sugar
Having the taste characteristic of sugar or honey.

bn:00087460v: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.

bn:00091091v: To eat a snack or light meal.
To eat small things in between meals.

bn:00018640n: A chocolate bar is a confection in bar form comprising some or all of the following components: cocoa solids, cocoa butter, sugar, and milk.
A confection in bar form that contains chocolate, cocoa, cocoa butter, etc..
A kind of candy in the shape of a bar, often made of milk chocolate in the United States, dark chocolate in Europe.
A kind of candy in the shape of a bar.
An oblong confectionery covered with chocolate.
Any candy bar, whether it contains chocolate or not.

bn:00018639n: Food made from ground roasted cocoa beans.
Chocolate is a typically sweet, usually brown, food preparation of Theobroma cacao seeds, roasted and ground, often flavored, as with vanilla.
Chocolate describes a number of raw and processed foods that originate from the tropical cacao tree.
Food produced from the seed of the tropical Theobroma cacao tree
A food made from ground roasted cocoa beans
A food made from roasted ground cacao beans

bn:00001880n: A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal
A dish served as the last course of a meal
A usage seen in the United Kingdom and some other Commonwealth countries.
Dessert is a typically sweet course that concludes an evening meal.
A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet course that concludes a meal

bn:00010746n: The term "collation" originates in the Roman Catholic Church, where it refers to the two small meals allowed on days of fasting, with or without abstinence.

bn:00035650n: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.
